newsitem.title: FRANCE: EU grain panel discusses imports to Spain, Portugal.
newsitem.headline: EU grain panel discusses imports to Spain, Portugal.

text.p: The European Union's cereals management committee was continuing talks in Brussels after the weekly grain tender and would vote on Thursday evening on proposals to allow new maize and sorghum imports to Spain and Portugal at preferential tariffs, European officials said.
The panel was discussing imports of 800,000 tonnes of maize and 150,000 tonnes of sorghum to Spain and imports of 250,000 tonnes of maize to Portugal in calendar 1997, they said.
The preferential imports are part of a decade-old trade agreement with the United States.
A decision was expected later on Thursday.
